references.reason: This paper introduces MusicLM, a large-scale text-to-music generation model that serves as a strong baseline and is compared against in the experiments.
This paper is a key reference for MusicGen, a model that provides a strong baseline for text-to-music generation which is compared with the proposed SongGen.

references.paper_title: Music Transformer: Generating music with long-term structure
references.reason: This paper introduces the Music Transformer, a model using a transformer architecture for music generation that forms an important early foundation for later work in text-to-song generation.

references.paper_title: Text-to-song: Towards controllable music generation incorporating vocals and accompaniment
references.reason: This paper proposes Melodist, a multi-stage model for text-to-song generation, which is directly compared with SongGen and highlights the advancements made by using a single stage method.

references.paper_title: Accompanied singing voice synthesis with fully text-controlled melody
references.reason: This paper introduces MelodyLM, another multi-stage model for text-to-song generation, offering another direct comparison to the proposed SongGen’s single-stage approach.
